There are many different safety precautions they take. When things happen on campus they will send everyone on campus a text saying what happened and where. And they have a couple apps to help with safety issues.
They have so many different clubs. But if you don't find one you like it's really easy to make a new one.
Kissing at the memorial tower at midnight is my favorite.
The experiences have at LSU make every dollar worth it. Even if you are out of state.

They have activities on campus all the time, or sporting games, or you can just hangout with your friends. It depends what you enjoy doing. But they have a bit of everything depending on what you like.
Don't go to Tigerland everyday, save yourself for BBN. And never ever drive off campus on game days. EVER!!
This school truly follows their motto of loving purple and living gold. It's an amazing school to attend.

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students LSU is probably best for students that don't mind being in a class of 200 or more. You also have to have thick-skin coming to a school of 32,000 people, your teacher probably won't know you exist, and the campus is huge so you must be ready to walk a lot! Tips for prospective students The best advice I could give a prospective LSU student would be, if you are able to attend a bridge program or simply take classes during the summer before your first fall semester, do so. I had the opportunity to attend a summer bridge program which allowed me to attend two classes, have free room and board, and become familiar with the campus before the fall semester began. Not only do you become familiar with the campus and learn to live on your own, you also learn the way things are done at the school, as well as simply meet people. Bang for the buck If you are an out-of-state student like me, be sure that you are aware of all the different scholarships that LSU offers. In fact, I got my out-of-state fees waved because my Mom attended an LSU affiliate school. So be aware that there are ways to attend your dream
